intro: Cyclopogon casanaensis, commonly known as the Casanensis Cyclopogon, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
